title: Jacqueline Jossa accentuates her curves in a fitted monochrome dress
text:
Jacqueline Jossa enjoyed a rare night without husband Dan Osborne on Tuesday evening as she attended the Specsavers’ Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards in London.

The former EastEnders star was alone while making her way into Westminster address 8 Northumberland Avenue ahead of the annual event.

But while Osborne was no doubt on babysitting duty, his wife ensured she caught the eye by sporting a stylish monochrome patterned dress that clung to her curves.

Here she comes: Jaqueline Jossa enjoyed a rare night without husband Dan Osborne on Tuesday evening as she attended the Specsavers’ Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards in London

With a cinched waist, the sleeveless dress ensured mother of two Jacqueline commanded attention as she mingled with gusts including Tulisa Contostavlos and Love Island’s Curtis Pritchard and Maura Higgins.

The actress added to her look with a pair of strappy black heels, while statement earrings and an embellished black clutch proved to be her only notable accessories.

Drawing attention to her naturally pretty features, Jacqueline tied her brunette locks into a tightly pulled high ponytail.

Looking good: The former EastEnders actress ensured she caught the eye by sporting a stylish monochrome patterned dress that clung to her curves

Finishing touches: Jacqueline added to her look with a pair of strappy black heels, while an embellished black clutch proved to be her only notable accessory

The night out comes following a turbulent year for the couple after Dan was alleged to have been caught kissing Love Island star Alexandra Cane, something the reality stars both vehemently denied.

And in April the former TOWIE star was spotted partying with blonde PA, Steph Ledigo, in Los Angeles, with both parties denying they are anything more than friends.

But talking about her marriage to new! magazine, Jacqueline insisted that their relationship is 'strong' as she added: 'We always have been. It's hard to explain it because no one would understand until you're living it...

Thumb's up: The British star was clearly in high spirits as she made her way home later that night

Going solo: Mother-of-two Jacqueline appeared to have left husband Dan on babysitting duty

'All I can say is that I know where I'm at and he knows where he's at. I'm still learning, he's still learning...

'We are very young. We are young to have three kids. It's a work in progress and nothing is perfect. We are still working on stuff.'

Jacqueline left her role as Lauren on Eastenders last year and in September she launched a performing arts academy in Bexleyheath, Kent.

The Jac Jossa Academy provides classes for a pre-school age group from three to six years, middle class from five to eight-years-old, and a top class group from nine to 12 and above.
description: The former EastEnders star was alone while making her way into Westminster address 8 Northumberland Avenue ahead of the annual event.
